meanings.definition: To bend or crease something over on itself
meanings.sent2: He always folds his clothes before putting them away.
meanings.sent3: The cat folded its tail around its body like a fluffy scarf.
meanings.sent4: The mountains folded into each other in the distance, creating a beautiful panorama.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly folded the dough to make perfect dumplings.

meanings.definition: To bring together or intertwine parts
meanings.sent1: She folded her hands in prayer.
meanings.sent2: The dancers folded into a graceful formation on stage.
meanings.sent3: The vines in the garden seemed to fold around each other in a friendly embrace.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the music folded seamlessly with the lyrics, creating a harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: The artist skillfully folded different colors together to create a stunning mosaic.

meanings.definition: To double over or bend in layers
meanings.sent1: He folded the blanket to make it warmer.
meanings.sent2: The pastry chef folded the dough to create flaky layers in the croissant.
meanings.sent3: The old map was so worn that it had started to fold in on itself.
meanings.sent4: The story unfolded like a beautifully folded origami crane, revealing its intricate layers.
meanings.sent5: The flower petals gently folded over each other, creating a delicate bloom.
